author: Dave Caldwell
title: Can Anyone Topple the Women’s Hockey Juggernauts?
text:
The balance of power in women’s ice hockey shifted, at least a little, on the evening of Feb. 17, 2006, when Sweden beat the U.S. in a shootout in the semifinals at the Winter Olympics in Turin, Italy.
The Swedes earned a berth in the gold-medal game. Canada beat them there, but the Swedes’ semifinal victory was the most significant result of the competition. It appeared that the world was finally catching up to mighty Canada and the U.S.
...
